CompleteMigrateJob.document:
This API is used to complete a data migration task.
For tasks in incremental migration mode, you need to call this API before migration gets ready for completion to stop migrating incremental data.
If the task status queried through the `DescribeMigrationJobs` API is ready (`Status` = `readyComplete`), you can call this API to complete the migration task.
CompleteMigrateJob.name: Completes a data migration task

ConfigureSubscribeJob.document: This API is used to configure data subscription instances.
ConfigureSubscribeJob.name: Configures a subscription task

ConfigureSyncJob.document: This API is used to configure a sync task.
ConfigureSyncJob.name: Configures a sync task

ContinueMigrateJob.document: This API is used to resume a paused migration task.
ContinueMigrateJob.name: Resumes a paused migration task

ContinueSyncJob.document: This API is used to resume a paused data sync task.
ContinueSyncJob.name: Resumes a paused sync task

CreateCheckSyncJob.document: This API is used to verify a sync task by checking required parameters and peripheral configuration.
CreateCheckSyncJob.name: Verifies a sync task

CreateCompareTask.document: This API is used to create a data consistency check task. After the task is successfully created, its ID will be returned in the format of `dts-8yv4w2i1-cmp-37skmii9`, and you can call `StartCompare` to start it.
CreateCompareTask.name: Creates a data consistency check task

CreateConsumerGroup.document: This API is used to creat a consumer group for the subscription instance.
CreateConsumerGroup.name: Creates a consumer group

CreateMigrateCheckJob.document:
This API is used to verify a migration task.
Before migration, you should call this API to create a check task. Migration will start only if the check succeeds. You can view the check result through the `DescribeMigrationCheckJob` API.
After successful check, if the migration task needs to be modified, a new check task should be created, and migration will start only after the new check succeeds.
CreateMigrateCheckJob.name: Verifies a migration task

CreateMigrationService.document: This API is used to purchase migration tasks. After the tasks are purchased successfully, a randomly generated list of task IDs will be returned. You can also call the `DescribeMigrationJobs` API to query the IDs of the successfully purchased tasks. Note that once a task is purchased successfully, the types and regions of the source and target databases cannot be changed.
CreateMigrationService.name: Purchases a migration task

CreateModifyCheckSyncJob.document: This API is used to check whether the current data sync task supports object modification after the task configuration is modified.
CreateModifyCheckSyncJob.name: Creates a check task for sync configuration modification

CreateSubscribe.document: This API is used to create a data subscription task.
CreateSubscribe.name: Creates a subscription task

CreateSubscribeCheckJob.document: This API is used to create a subscription check task. The task must have successfully called the ConfigureSubscribeJob interface to configure all necessary information before starting the check.
CreateSubscribeCheckJob.name: Checks a subscription task

CreateSyncJob.document: This API is used to create a sync task.
CreateSyncJob.name: Creates a sync task

DeleteCompareTask.document: This API is used to delete a data consistency check task, which can be called when the task status is `success`, `failed`, or `canceled`.
DeleteCompareTask.name: Deletes a data consistency check task

DeleteConsumerGroup.document: This API is used to delete a consumer group of a subscription task.
DeleteConsumerGroup.name: Deletes a consumer group

DescribeCheckSyncJobResult.document: This API is used to query the result of the sync check task and check the required parameters and peripheral configurations.
DescribeCheckSyncJobResult.name: Queries the result of a sync check task

DescribeCompareReport.document: This API is used to query the details of a data consistency check task.
DescribeCompareReport.name: Queries the details of a data consistency check task

DescribeCompareTasks.document: This API is used to query the list of data consistency check tasks under the current task.
DescribeCompareTasks.name: Queries the list of data consistency check tasks

DescribeConsumerGroups.document: This API is used to get consumer group details for the subscription instance configuration.
DescribeConsumerGroups.name: Gets the consumer group details of the data subscription

DescribeMigrateDBInstances.document: This API is used to query migratable database instances.
DescribeMigrateDBInstances.name: Queries the list of migratable database instances

DescribeMigrationCheckJob.document:
This API is used to get the check result and query the check status and progress after a check is created. 
If the check succeeds, you can call the `StartMigrateJob` API to start migration.
If the check fails, the cause can be queried. Modify the migration configuration or adjust relevant parameters of the source/target instances through the `ModifyMigrationJob` API based on the error message.
DescribeMigrationCheckJob.name: Queries the result of a migration check task

DescribeMigrationDetail.document: This API is used to query the details of a migration task.
DescribeMigrationDetail.name: Queries the details of a migration task

DescribeMigrationJobs.document: This API is used to query the list of data migration tasks.
DescribeMigrationJobs.name: Queries the list of data migration tasks

DescribeModifyCheckSyncJobResult.document: This API is used to query the result of the created check task for object modification.
DescribeModifyCheckSyncJobResult.name: Queries the result of the object modification check task

DescribeOffsetByTime.document: This API is used to query the latest offset before the specified time in KafkaTopic.The offset output by the interface is the closest offset to this time.If the input time is much later than the current time, the output is equivalent to the latest offset;If the input time is much earlier than the current time, the output is equivalent to the oldest offset;If the input is empty, the default time is 0, which is the oldest offset to be queried.
DescribeOffsetByTime.name: Queries Kafka offset

DescribeSubscribeCheckJob.document: This API is used to query the results of a subscription check task.
DescribeSubscribeCheckJob.name: Queries check results

DescribeSubscribeDetail.document: This API is used to get the configuration information of the data subscription instance.
DescribeSubscribeDetail.name: Queries the subscription task details

DescribeSubscribeJobs.document: This API is used to get the information list of data subscription instances. Pagination is enabled by default with 20 results returned each time.
DescribeSubscribeJobs.name: Gets data subscription instance list

DescribeSubscribeReturnable.document: This API is used to query whether a subscription task can be terminated and returned.
DescribeSubscribeReturnable.name: Queries whether the subscription instance can be returned

DescribeSyncJobs.document: This API is used to query the information of a sync task.
DescribeSyncJobs.name: Queries the information of a sync task

DestroyIsolatedSubscribe.document: This API is used to deactivate an isolated data subscription instance.
DestroyIsolatedSubscribe.name: Deactivates isolated data subscription tasks

DestroyMigrateJob.document: This API is used to delete a data migration task. For a billed task, you must first call the `IsolateMigrateJob` API to isolate it and make sure that it is in **Isolated** status before calling this API to delete it. For a free task, you can directly call the `IsolateMigrateJob` API to delete it.
DestroyMigrateJob.name: Deletes a data migration task

DestroySyncJob.document: This API is used to delete a sync task. Only tasks in **Isolated** status can be completely deleted. After deletion, you can call the `DescribeSyncJobs` API to get the task list. If the deleted task is not in the list, it is deleted successfully.
DestroySyncJob.name: Deletes a sync task

IsolateMigrateJob.document: This API is used to isolate and return a data migration task. After calling this API, you can call the `DescribeMigrationJobs` API to query the latest task status. For a billed task, after isolating it, you can call `RecoverMigrationJob` to recover it or call `DestroyMigrateJob` to delete it. For a free task, calling this API will directly delete it permanently.
IsolateMigrateJob.name: Isolates a data migration task

IsolateSubscribe.document: This API is used to isolate the subscription task. After calling, the subscription task will not be available. Pay-as-you-go tasks will stop billing, and monthly subscription tasks will refund automatically.
IsolateSubscribe.name: Destroys a subscription task

IsolateSyncJob.document: This API is used to isolate a sync task. After the task is isolated, you can call the `DescribeSyncJobs` API to query its status, call `RecoverSyncJob` to recover it, or directly delete it. For a free task, calling this API will directly delete it permanently.
IsolateSyncJob.name: Isolates a sync task

ModifyCompareTask.document: This API is used to modify the parameters of a data consistency check task after it is created and before it starts.
ModifyCompareTask.name: Modifies a data consistency check task

ModifyCompareTaskName.document: This API is used to rename a data consistency check task.
ModifyCompareTaskName.name: Renames a data consistency check task

ModifyConsumerGroupDescription.document: This API is used to modify the description of the specified subscription consumption group.
ModifyConsumerGroupDescription.name: Modifies the description of a consumer group

ModifyConsumerGroupPassword.document: This API is used to modify the password of the specified subscription consumer group.
ModifyConsumerGroupPassword.name: Modifies the password of a consumer group

ModifyMigrateJobSpec.document: This API is used to adjust the specification of a pay-as-you-go task. After calling this API, you can call the `DescribeMigrationJobs` API to query the latest task status.
ModifyMigrateJobSpec.name: Adjusts the task specification

ModifyMigrateName.document: This API is used to rename a migration task.
ModifyMigrateName.name: Renames a migration task

ModifyMigrateRateLimit.document: This API is used to restrict the rate limit of the task, when a user finds that migration task has a large impact on the load of user's database.
ModifyMigrateRateLimit.name: Modifies the rate limit of the migration tasks

ModifyMigrateRuntimeAttribute.document: This API is used to modify task runtime attributes. This interface is different from the configuration class interface and does not perform state machine evaluation.
ModifyMigrateRuntimeAttribute.name: Modifies task runtime attributes

ModifyMigrationJob.document: This API is used to configure a migration task. After it is configured successfully, you can call the `CreateMigrationCheckJob` API to create a check task, and only after it passes the check can it be started.
ModifyMigrationJob.name: Configures a migration task

ModifySubscribeAutoRenewFlag.document: This API is used to modify the auto-renewal flag of your subscription instance. Only the monthly subscription modification task makes sense. After modifying, the pay-as-you-go task has no impact.
ModifySubscribeAutoRenewFlag.name: Modifies the auto-renewal flag of a subscription instance

ModifySubscribeName.document: This API is used to modify the name of the data subscription instance.
ModifySubscribeName.name: Modifies the name of the data subscription instance

ModifySubscribeObjects.document: This API is used to modify the data subscription object and Kafka partition rule. For MongoDB subscription, you can also modify the output aggregation rule.
ModifySubscribeObjects.name: Modifies subscription object

ModifySyncJobConfig.document: This API is used to modify the configuration of a data sync task after the task is started.\n Configuration modification steps:  Modify sync task configuration -> Create a modification check task -> Query the check task result -> Start the configuration modification check task
ModifySyncJobConfig.name: Modifies sync task configuration

ModifySyncRateLimit.document: This API is used to restrict the rate limit of the task, when a user finds that the sync task has a large impact on the load of user's database.
ModifySyncRateLimit.name: Modifies the rate limit of the sync tasks

PauseMigrateJob.document: This API is used to pause a migration task.
PauseMigrateJob.name: Pauses a migration task

PauseSyncJob.document: This API is used to pause a data sync task.
PauseSyncJob.name: Pauses a data sync task

RecoverMigrateJob.document: This API is used to recover a data migration task in **Isolated** status. After calling this API, you can call the `DescribeMigrationJobs` API to query the latest task status.
RecoverMigrateJob.name: Recovers a data migration task

RecoverSyncJob.document: This API is used to recover a sync task in **Isolated** status. After calling this API, you can call the `DescribeSyncJobs` API to query the latest task status.
RecoverSyncJob.name: Recovers a sync task

ResetConsumerGroupOffset.document: This API is used to reset the offset of the subscription consumer group. Call the DescribeConsumerGroups API to query the status of the consumer group, only when the status is Dead or Empty can this operation be executed. Otherwise, the reset will not be effective and the API will not return any error.
ResetConsumerGroupOffset.name: Resets Kafka offset

ResetSubscribe.document: This API is used to reset the subscription instance. After resetting, the subscription task can be reconfigured.You can call DescribeSubscribeDetail to query the subscription information to determine whether the subscription is successful. When SubsStatus changes to notStarted, it means the reset is successful.
ResetSubscribe.name: Resets a subscription task

ResizeSyncJob.document: This API is used to adjust the specification of a pay-as-you-go sync task. After this API is called, the backend needs to take about 3-5 minutes to implement the adjustment. You can call the `DescribeSyncJobs` API to query the latest task status.
ResizeSyncJob.name: Adjusts the specification of a sync task

ResumeMigrateJob.document: This API is used to retry an abnormal or failed Redis data migration task. Note that this operation will skip the check stage and directly start the task, just like by calling `StartMigrationJob`. After calling this API, you can call the `DescribeMigrationJobs` API to query the latest task status.
ResumeMigrateJob.name: Retries a migration task

ResumeSubscribe.document: This API is used to resume faulty subscription tasks. When the status of the subscription task is set to error, you can resume task via this API.
ResumeSubscribe.name: Resumes a subscription task

ResumeSyncJob.document: This API is used to retry a sync task after certain resolvable errors are reported. After calling this API, you can call the `DescribeSyncJobs` API to query the latest task status.
ResumeSyncJob.name: Retries a sync task

SkipCheckItem.document: This API is used for the backend to skip a failed check item. Theoretically, to execute a migration task normally, any check step cannot be skipped, and the check must be passed. For products or links that support check item skipping, see [Check Item Overview](https://www.tencentcloud.com/document/product/571/42551).
SkipCheckItem.name: Skips migration check items

SkipSyncCheckItem.document: This API is used for the backend to skip a failed check item. Theoretically, to execute a sync task normally, any check step cannot be skipped, and the check must be passed. For products or links that support check item skipping, see [Check Item Overview](https://www.tencentcloud.com/document/product/571/42551).
SkipSyncCheckItem.name: Skips sync check items

StartCompare.document: This API is used to start a data consistency check task after creating it by calling the `CreateCompareTask` API. After calling this API, you can call the `DescribeCompareTasks` API to query the latest task status.
StartCompare.name: Starts a data consistency check task

StartMigrateJob.document: This API (`StartMigrationJob`) is used to start a migration task. After calling this API, you can call the `DescribeMigrationJobs` API to query the latest task status.
StartMigrateJob.name: Starts a data migration task

StartModifySyncJob.document: This API is used to start the configuration modification process when the modification check task status becomes “success”.
StartModifySyncJob.name: Starts the configuration modification process

StartSubscribe.document: This API is used to start a Kafka version of the data subscription instance. This interface can be called only when the status of the subscription task is checkPass.
StartSubscribe.name: Starts a subscription task

StartSyncJob.document: This API is used to start a sync task.
StartSyncJob.name: Starts a sync task

StopCompare.document: This API is used to stop a data consistency check task.
StopCompare.name: Stops a data consistency check task

StopMigrateJob.document:
This API is used to stop a data migration task.
After calling this API, you can call the `DescribeMigrationJobs` API to query the latest task status.
StopMigrateJob.name: Stops a data migration task

StopSyncJob.document: This API is used to stop a sync task. After calling this API, you can call the `DescribeSyncJobs` API to query the latest task status.
StopSyncJob.name: Stops a sync task

members.document: View configuration used for consistency check. When ViewMode is partial, it needs to be filled in (consistency check does not check views, and the current parameters are disabled).Note: This field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.

Note: This field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.

The number of threads, which defaults to 1. Value range: 1-5.
Note: This field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.

Note: This field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.

members.document: Data migration task ID
members.name: JobId

members.document: The way to complete the task, which is supported only for legacy MySQL migration tasks. Valid values: `waitForSync` (wait for the source-replica lag to become 0 before stopping); `immediately` (complete immediately without waiting for source-replica sync). Default value: `waitForSync`.
members.name: CompleteMode

members.document: The unique request ID, generated by the server, will be returned for every request (if the request fails to reach the server for other reasons, the request will not obtain a RequestId). RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.document: Data subscription instance ID
members.name: SubscribeId

members.document: Data subscription type. Valid values for non-mongo DatabaseType: all (full instance update); dml (data update); ddl (structure update); dmlAndDdl (data + structure update). Valid values for mongo DatabaseType: all (full instance update); database (subscribe to a table); collection (subscribe to a collection).
members.name: SubscribeMode

members.document: Source database access type. Valid values: extranet (public network); vpncloud (VPN access); dcg (Direct Connect); ccn (CCN); cdb (database); cvm (self-build on CVM); intranet (intranet); vpc (VPC). Note: The specific optional values depend on the current link support capabilities.
members.name: AccessType

members.document: Database node information
members.name: Endpoints

members.document: Kafka configuration
members.name: KafkaConfig

members.document: Subscription database table information. When SubscribeMode is not all or ddl, SubscribeObjects is a required parameter.
members.name: SubscribeObjects

members.document: Subscription data format, such as: protobuf, json, avro. Note: The specific optional values depend on the current link support capabilities. For details on the data format, please refer to the consumption demo documentation on the official website.
members.name: Protocol

members.document: mongo optional parameter: output aggregation settings.
members.name: PipelineInfo

members.document: Additional information added for the business. The parameter name is called key, and the parameter value is called value.Optional parameters for mysql: ProcessXA. If true is filled in, it will be processed. If it is left blank or filled with other values, it will not be processed.Optional parameters for mongo: SubscribeType. Currently only changeStream is supported. If not filled in, the default is changeStream.Other businesses currently have no optional parameters.
members.name: ExtraAttr

members.document: The unique request ID, generated by the server, will be returned for every request (if the request fails to reach the server for other reasons, the request will not obtain a RequestId). RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.document: Sync task instance ID in the format of `sync-werwfs23`, which is used to identify a sync task.
members.name: JobId

members.document: Source database access type. Valid values: `cdb` (database); `cvm` (self-build on CVM); `vpc` (VPC); `extranet` (public network); `vpncloud` (VPN access); `dcg` (Direct Connect); `ccn` (CCN); `intranet` (intranet). Note that the valid values are subject to the current link.
members.name: SrcAccessType

members.document: Target database access type. Valid values: `cdb` (database); `cvm` (self-build on CVM); `vpc` (VPC); `extranet` (public network); `vpncloud` (VPN access); `dcg` (Direct Connect); `ccn` (CCN); `intranet` (intranet); `ckafka` (CKafka instance). Note that the valid values are subject to the current link.

If multiple rules are configured, the first hit rule will take effect according to the configured order.

members.document: Rule type. Valid values for non-mongo products: table (partitioned by table name); pk (partitioned by table name + primary key); cols (partitioned by column name). Valid values for mongo: collection (partitioned by collection name); collectionAndObjectId (partitioned by collection + primary key). Note: This field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: RuleType

members.document: Database name matching rule, please fill in the regular expression.Note: This field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: DbPattern

members.document: Table name matching rule. If DatabaseType is mongodb, it matches the collection name.Note: This field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: TablePattern

members.document: Column name. This field is required if RuleType is cols. The subscription task will use the value of this column to calculate the partition. Mongo does not partition by column, so there is no need to pass this field.Note: This field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: Columns

members.document: DML and DDL options to be synced. Valid values: `Insert` (INSERT), `Update` (UPDATE), `Delete` (DELETE), `DDL` (structure sync), `PartialDDL` (custom option, which is used together with `DdlOptions`). This parameter is required, and its value will overwrite the previous value. Note: This field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: OpTypes

members.document: DDL options to be synced. This parameter is required when `OpTypes` is `PartialDDL`, and its value will overwrite the previous value. Note: This field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: DdlOptions

members.document: Conflict resolution method. Valid values: `ReportError` (Report error), `Ignore` (Ignore), `Cover` (Overwrite), `ConditionCover` (Conditionally overwrite). Currently, this parameter cannot be modified if the target of the link is Kafka. Note: This field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: ConflictHandleType

members.document: Detailed options of the conflict resolution method, such as the conditionally overwritten rows and condition operations for the “conditionally overwrite” method. The internal field of this parameter cannot be modified separately. If this parameter needs to be updated, update it fully. Note: This field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: ConflictHandleOption

members.document:
Attributes that need to be modified. This structure is designed as a generic structure to separate customized attributes for multiple businesses.
For instance, for Redis:
{
"Key": "DstWriteMode", // Target database write mode
"Value": "normal" // clearData (clear target instance data), overwrite (perform task in overwrite manner), normal (follow normal procedure, no additional actions, this is the default value)
},
{
"Key": "IsDstReadOnly", // Whether to set target database as read-only during migration
"Value": "true" // true (set as read-only), false (do not set as read-only)
}

members.document: Kafka partitioning policy. If left blank, it will remain unchanged by default. If filled, it will replace the original policy.
members.name: DistributeRules

members.document: Default partitioning policy. Data that does not meet the regex in DistributeRules will be partitioned according to the default partitioning policy.Default strategies supported by non-mongo products: table - partitioned by table name, pk - partitioned by table name + primary key. Mongo's default strategy only supports: collection-partitioned by collection name.This field is used in conjunction with DistributeRules. If DistributeRules is configured, this field is also required. If this field is configured, it is considered as configuring a DistributeRules, and the original partitioning policy will also be overwritten.
members.name: DefaultRuleType

SubscribeKafkaConfig.document: Number of subscribed Kafka partitions and partition rules. mariadb, percona, tdsqlmysql, tdpg do not support custom partitions, so DistributeRules and DefaultRuleType can be left blank, but NumberOfPartitions is required.

members.document: Number of Kafka partitions. Valid values: 1, 4, 8.Note: This field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: NumberOfPartitions

members.document: Partition rules. This field is required when NumberOfPartitions > 1.Note: This field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: DistributeRules

members.document:
Default partitioning policy. If NumberOfPartitions > 1, this field is required. Data that does not meet the regex in DistributeRules will be partitioned according to the default partitioning policy.Valid values for non-mongo products: table (partitioned by table name); pk (partitioned by table name + primary key). Valid values for mongo: collection (partitioned by collection name). This field is used in conjunction with DistributeRules. If this field is configured, it is considered as configuring a DistributeRules.
Note: This field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: DefaultRuleType

members.document:
The temp tables to be synced. This parameter is mutually exclusive with `NewTableName`. It is valid only when the configured sync objects are table-level ones and `TableEditMode` is `pt`. To sync temp tables generated when pt-osc or other tools are used during the sync process, you must configure this parameter first. For example, if you want to perform the pt-osc operation on a table named "t1", configure this parameter as ["\_t1\_new","\_t1\_old"]; to perform the gh-ost operation on t1, configure it as ["\_t1\_ghc","\_t1\_gho","\_t1\_del"]. Temp tables generated by pt-osc and gh-ost operations can be configured at the same time.
Note: This field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: TmpTables

The temp tables to be migrated. This parameter is mutually exclusive with `NewTableName`. It is valid only when the configured migration objects are table-level ones and `TableEditMode` is `pt`. For example, if you want to perform the pt-osc operation on a table named "t1", configure this parameter as ["_t1_new","_t1_old"]; to perform the gh-ost operation on t1, configure it as ["_t1_ghc","_t1_gho","_t1_del"]. Temp tables generated by pt-osc and gh-ost operations can be configured at the same time.

members.document: Topic partitioning policy. If the topic sync policy is delivering data to multiple custom topics (`TopicType` = `Multi`), the value of this parameter is `Random` (deliver to a random partition). If the topic sync policy is delivering all data to a single topic (`TopicType` = `Single`), this parameter has three valid values: `AllInPartitionZero` (deliver all data to partition0), `PartitionByTable` (partition by table name), `PartitionByTableAndKey` (partition by table name and primary key).
members.example: Random（自定义topic时使用），AllInPartitionZero（全部投递至partition0）， PartitionByTable（按表名分区），PartitionByTableAndKey（按表名加主键分区）， PartitionByCols（按列名分区）
members.name: PartitionType

members.document: Database name matching rule. This parameter takes effect only when `TopicType` is `Multi`. Valid values: `Regular` (match by regex), `Default` (default rule for the remaining databases that cannot be matched by regex). The default rule must be included in the array of matching rules.
members.example: Regular（正则匹配）, Default(不符合匹配规则的剩余库)
members.name: DbMatchMode

members.document: Database name, which can only be matched by regex when `TopicType` is `Multi` and `DbMatchMode` is `Regular`.

members.document: Table name matching rule. This parameter takes effect only when `TopicType` is `Multi`. Valid values: `Regular` (match by regex), `Default` (default rule for the remaining databases that cannot be matched by regex). The default rule must be included in the array of matching rules.
members.example: Regular（正则匹配）, Default(不符合匹配规则的剩余表)
members.name: TableMatchMode

members.document: Table name, which can only be matched by regex when `TopicType` is `Multi` and `DbMatchMode` is `Regular`.
